comment: Great Professor and very understanding. Textbook was used in this class and highly needed for a lot of assignments. He gives great feedback on graded assignments and makes great video notes for each chapter that explained each module perfectly. All assignments were broken down into parts that better helped me understand each module.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He was an incredible professor, you can tell he really cares about his students. He taught amazing and he knew a lot about journalism. Just make sure you arrive to class on time and you keep up with work. There are not too many assignments so every point counts. If you can take Dr. Gillman I would do it!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Excellent professor who really cares about his students, would recommend to everyone.

Gillman is a memorable teacher for his charm, wit, and care towards his students. I would definitely take him again. Yes, he grades honestly, but he gives good feedback especially if you participate in class. He is understanding and fun to talk to. Make sure you don't take him for granted though.

Professor Gillman was great! His class isn't easy because there's so many ways to mess up and you're basically changing your whole writing style. Making a B, or even C in this class, as he states, is very good. I highly recommend taking Professor Gillman! MAKE SURE TO HAVE AN AP STYLEBOOK!

Prof Gillman was one of the best teachers I have had in Com. He is very caring of his students, and he will do anything to help you succeed. He is a tough grader, but it only helps you become better. And you will improve. The textbook is needed and EMPHASIZED, and you have reading quizzes over chapters, but they're do-able.

Prof Gillman really cares about you and is an amazing professor, but the content of the course is very precise and difficult. You need an AP Stylebook to succeed in this class. Overall, he's the best option for this tough class.

It isn't easy but Gillman gives you the resources to succeed. If you take it online, the AP Stylebook is your god (it's basically a journalist's thesaurus). Email Professor Gillman when you have questions. You write a lot, but the class is also about writing as little as possible. The writing techniques you learn will likely carry into your career

Prof Gillman will make you work for it for sure, but he is such a great guy. GET AN AP STYLEBOOK. It is worth it and will help you in his class. Would definitely take him again. Really cares for his students.

You need your textbook for discussion posts. He gives you lots of grade opportunities but grades harder. He is a guy that wants you to do well and wants to help you. He gave us opporunities to come to class for help. There's quizes, grammar quizes, and news leads. He focuses a lot on news leads and writing news.

Professor Gillman and his class was amazing. He is always funny and he teaches in an interactive way which makes it easy to learn and understand. There is little outside work you have to do for this class so attendance is very important. But as long as you come to class you will love it. His quizzes are very simple and the writings aren't hard.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: I expected this class to be super hard as it's the most failed class at KSU, but Gillman helped literally so much. He was always willing to help every student in the class and very accessible through email. There was never any homework unless for a 5 question reading quiz... super easy. Gillman is also hilarious and very friendly. 100% recommend

I am sad that due to COVID-19 our class had to come to an early end. From first impression, he might come across as boring or a tough professor, but he is actually one of the most genuine and funny professors I have had in all of my 3 years of college. This is a tough class as it is, but he is the best to take for it! Just trust me!

This was a tough class but Professor Gillman made it a great time. At first your grades made be low but don't get intimidated, they will improve over the semester. Gillman is very kind and approachable so feel free to ask him any questions. There are lots of grades over the semester so you have many ways to improve your grade. Just don't miss class

Professor Gillman is the best. He wants his students to be successful. He allows you to turn in make-up work at the end of the semester. There are only a few grades in this class, but if you put forth effort to understand the content, you will succeed. Attendance is important so you don't get behind. He is the most understanding professor.

Despite this class being tough, Gillman is the BEST professor. He is really easy to talk to and is such a fun goofy guy. You definitely need to work for your grade but he will always help you. I would take him again in a heartbeat.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Its a tough class and hes a hard grader but hes a nice professor who isnt out to fail you. He lets out class early most of the time. He kind of prepares you for the entrance exam. However, the work gets a little repetitive after a while so its a little boring but overall a great class and he tries to make everyone feel included.

I loved this class! He actually cared about whether or not you do well. This quizzes are not hard if you prepare and do the readings. He is a great professor! He knows most people don't like to sit and listen to all class so he does an activity or something every class. We also got out early a lot. He really prepares you for the entrance exam!

I wish I had him for all of my classes. He got to know the students (the ones who wanted to be known) and had casual conversations with us. The subject can be tricky but he does his best to make sure you understand it. A great guy. I miss this class

He is awesome. Makes class fun and almost always lets you out early. The class is just hard in nature which is why I got a B. Everything is done in class, no homework. He went over everything you need for the final so its easy. Just go to every class and make sure you have BOTH of the books. HIGHLY RECOMMEND
Sweetest professor ever! Tough class, but he makes it bearable. Love him!

Professor Gillman was my favorite professor so far. He is extremely helpful and easy to talk to and he makes class interesting. The material is based off the textbook but he explains it so well in a step by step manner that anyone can understand it. Would absolutely recommend him for class.

I was worried going into this class b/c it it is the most failed class in the Comm School (so I've heard) but I'm so glad I took it with Prof. Gillman! All of the work is done in class, and he frequently provides useful feedback on your writing. You won't do well if you don't buy the books, I used mine all the time. I'd gladly take his class again!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Absolute must take. He has great energy and really wants you to do your best. I'd take him the rest of my college career if I could

Professor Gillman is actually a great professor! He is definitely a tough grader, but if pay attention, your grades should improve throughout the semester. Bring your AP Stylebook to EVERY SINGLE CLASS or you'll regret it. The way the class is set up, if you miss it, you'll be lost and you only get 3 absences.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Love love loved this dude. He's so quirky and really easy to listen to. For me, he said things in a way I could remember and I feel like I could really see my writing improve throughout the semester. He also cares about his students and wants everybody to do well. There's no homework, you learn everything in class. Take him if you can!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: come to class. hard grader but an honest one so you really do better yourself through this class
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Gillman is hilarious and very knowledgeable of the material he teaches. I loved his class and, since taking it, I have improved in my writing a lot. The course uses Associated Press Style writing, which is a little difficult to get used to. USE YOUR RESOURCES and you will be fine; however, this class is NOT for people who hate writing.

I personally LOVED Professor Gillman. This class isn't really that hard, but if you don't show up or you don't put in effort you will not get a good grade. I missed one class when a News Story was due and that kept me from making a B in the class. But he really does care about his students and what I learned in this class was useful info! TAKE HIM
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Gillman will go down as one of my favorite professors. He's knowledgeable and gives great feedback on your writing. Super nice and a great support system too! The class is quite challenging. Lots of quizzes (easy As) and lots of writing assignments (hard depending upon your writing skills and knowledge of the AP book). MUST TAKE!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof. Gillman is awesome. He is a tough grader but he makes you learn the material. He gives AP style and chapter quizzes, which are not the easiest. Both books are required! Get them both you need them!! He definitely knows his stuff. He lets class out whenever he's done talking, which is always early. He's great, I'd definitely recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Without any prior knowledge of AP style or news writing, it's almost impossible to get an A in COM2135 (keep in mind this is a tough class regardless of the professor). Professor Gillman knows his stuff, but his grading is super harsh and nit-picky. I've learned a lot though, and I can tell my writing has improved substantially.

Do NOT take this class with him.. he is unfamiliar with the topics he is teaching and isn't available for help EVER. Take the course with Grendel- she wrote the book that is required for the class.   I really wish I would have taken the course with her instead.

Great at teaching Public Writing. He use to work for the AJC and knows what he is talking about. You must show up to class to get a good grade, period! Just show up and do your work and you will be fine! I have heard horror stories about students having to retake writing for public com, but not if you take Gillman and do your work!!!
